enum.key: Three Way Accept Waiting Release Active
Three Way Accept Waiting Hold Active
Three Way Add Held To 3 Way
WBS Test Set Codecs Send BAC
BLE RC: Enable PTS Test Mode
BLE RC: Disable PTS Test Mode
BLE RC: PTS Mode Next Event
BLE RC: Change Write Mode Priority
TWS Master Device Trim Volume Up
TWS Master Device Trim Volume Down
TWS Slave Device Trim Volume Up
TWS Slave Device Trim Volume Down

enum.desc: 50ms B6 G8 B6 G8 B6 G8 B6 G8 B6 G8 B6 G8
50ms A6 REST A6 REST A6 REST A6 REST A6 REST

enum.key: 4 Low to High Long at Top
4 High to Low Long at Bottom

enum.desc: 50ms G7 G5 G7 G5 G7 G5 Repeat after 250ms
48ms C6 E6 C6 E6 C6 E6 C6 E6 C6 E6 C6 REST C6 E6 C6 E6 C6 E6 C6 E6 C6 E6 C6
83ms C5 REST 83mS E5 REST 83mS G5 REST 124mS B5 498mS REST 372mS C6

ConfigItem.Desc: User Event or System Event associated with the configuration.
User Event associated with the configuration.
Sink system state associated with the configuration.
The Logical Input in the Sink to which Physical Signals can be assigned via the Sink configuration.

enum.key: When Connected To Hub Trickle Charge

ConfigItem.Desc: The 'Virtual Button' IDs allow you to map one or more IR or BLE inputs onto a User Event.
The 'Virtual Button' ID the IR code translates to (allows up to 16 RC buttons to be supported)
The 'Virtual Button' ID the HID code translates to (allows up to 16 RC buttons to be supported)
0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-2550ms (in 10ms steps)
0-10,000ms (in 50ms steps)
Specifies the number of times the sequence will repeat (unless superceded by another event) before it times out. When set to 0 the sequence will not time out. 0-255

The time between ramp steps to use. There are 16 ramping steps used to Dim on or off an LED. It is important to ensure that the (Dim time * 16) is less than the on time /off time for the ramp to complete. 0-255
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED A
Specifies the PIO that is referred to in the PS Key attributes as LED B
Defines the LED(s) that the sequence will display when a filter is not applied.
If this bit is set then this LED pattern will be shown regardless of whether the LEDs have been disabled or not.
Determines the type of filter to be applied when the filter is activated. Setting this value will specify which filter parameters will be used by the Sink for this filter.

enum.disable: Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Colour,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Colour,Filter to Cancel,Follow LED Delay [ms]
Speed Factor,Speed Action,Filter to Cancel,LED to Use,Follow LED Delay [ms]

ConfigItem.Desc: Defines the LED(s) that the sequence will display when the COLOUR filter is active.
Defines the filter that will be cancelled when this CANCEL filter becomes activated. The filter number - e.g. 'Filter 0' - will cancel the filter configured at row index 0 in this table.
Specifies the PIO that will be driven when either the OVERRIDE or FOLLOW filter is active. (This field is shared by both filter types).
Defines the time offset in ms between the original pattern flashes and FOLLOW filter pattern flashes, when it is active (in 50ms steps).
This field specifies the action to apply to the LED pattern when the SPEED filter is active.
The multiplier/divider to be applied to the LED pattern when the SPEED filter is active.
If this bit is set then this LED pattern will be shown regardless of whether the LEDs have been disabled or not.
For the mapped System or User event to be generated, the Sink must be in the state specified. (The other attribute conditions must also be met).

The Logical Input ID Assigned list is used to specify the inputs that must be asserted in order to generate the mapped System or User Event. The mapping of Logical Inputs to specific Physical Input Signals used (i.e. PIOs) is configured elsewhere in this tool (under Button->Translation table).
In addition to the Logical Input mask stimuli, the VREG enable signal can be configured as a stimulus for the mapped System or User event.
In addition to the Logical Input mask stimuli, the Charger detect signal can be configured as a stimulus for the mapped System or User event.
Specifies the duration for which the selected Logical Input must be asserted in order to generate the mapped System or User Event.
Specifies the index of the Auido Prompt file in the Sink file system. This field is autogenerated by the config Tool and should not be directly written by the user.
Determines in which Sink system states the Audio Prompt mapped to this User Event can be played. If the User Event occurs and the Sink is in a state masked off, the Audio Prompt will not be played.
This bit causes the Audio Prompt not to be played if SCO or Wired audio is currently routed.
Any queued Audio Prompts or Tones will be flushed when an event occurs with an Audio Prompt configured with this bit set.
Specifies the Physical signal that will be mapped to the Logical Input selected. When the physical signal is asserted this will cause the Logical Input in the Sink to also be asserted.
When Vbat (ie. the battery voltage level) crosses the threshold specified in this setting it will cause the mapped notification event to be raised.
The notification events raised can be configured to be sent during any of the specified operating modes.

bitfield.key: On User Request for Battery Level
On Initial Reading for Battery Level

ConfigItem.Desc: The User or System Event mapped to the Vbat threshold transition.
Set to use this entry to control the charger
Boost charging can be disabled or set to internal or externally controlled boost if the device and firmware revision supports it.
The voltage source for the IC can be set to CHARGER or Vbat
When checked the Sink will reduce to the minimum power consumption possible. Useful for powering off the device at certain temperatures.
When set the LEDs are disabled while charging.
Charge current specified in mA.

CSR8600 range of devices can use voltage type which allows the user to specify the exact voltage cut off for charging, the BlueCore5 range of ICs use trim type whereby a small trim value may be applied to the present voltage cut off value.
End of charging trim voltage adjustment value for use on BlueCore5 range of devices.
End of charging cut off voltage value for CSR8600 range of devices. The scaling of the threshold is (value *20) in mV.
The Volume Profile Id that will be selected when a Volume Up event occurs.
The Volume Profile Id that will be selected when a Volume Down event occurs.
Specifies the Audio Tone that the Sink will play on entering this Volume Profile.
Specifies the gain that will be applied in dBr for this Volume Profile.
Audio Tone to play when the mapped System or User Event occurs.
User Event that will be originated when the mapped Button Sequence is asserted in the correct order.
The first part of the Button Sequence.
The second part of the Button Sequence.
The third part of the Button Sequence. N/A indicates the Sequence to use is only 2 Button presses long.
The fourth part of the Button Sequence. N/A indicates the Sequence to use is only 3 Button presses long.
The fifth part of the Button Sequence. N/A indicates the Sequence to use is only 4 Button presses long.
The sixth part of the Button Sequence. N/A indicates the Sequence to use is only 5 Button presses long.
Specifies whether the charger is enabled in this state.
Specifies whether boost charging is to be used and what type of boost charging.
Selects the voltage source for the chip, can be set to CHARGER or VBAT.
When set the Sink reduces power to an absolute minimum.
When set the LEDs are disabled while charging.
Specifies the maximum charging current in mA.

Each entry below specifies an I2S command word that in the I2S raw buffer. This is effectively an array of packets. The initialisation block are the first packets in the array, followed by volume and then shutdown blocks.
User Event or System Event associated with the configuration.
AT Command to send when the mapped System or User Event occurs.
Each entry below specifies a character in an AT command.
Each entry below specifies a word of data in the User Defined Tones.
The application state(s) for which the event *user_event* will be valid
Which 'Virtual Button' event is required to cause the User event to trigger

The Application User Event that will be triggered when the Virtual Button event meets the required conditions (this is offset from EVENTS_USR_MESSAGE_BASE, (i.e. for EventUsrPowerOn, this value will be set to 1)
The address of the remote control that sent the IR code (an Infrared remote may use different addresses for different buttons, so need to ensure the code was actually sent from the known RC)
The infrared code sent by the remote controller that converts to *input_id* for the input manager to process
The HID Code sent by the remote control, Consumer HID has some values that are 12-bit length (between 0x0 and 0xFFF)

ConfigGroup.Id: I2C Control for External I2S Amplifier

ConfigPatternArray.Name: I2S Data Word
ConfigPatternArray.Desc: This is the raw data of the various I2C Initialisation, Volume and Shutdown commands.

ConfigItem.Desc: Specifies how many I2C Initialisation commands are specified in the Raw Command Data, i.e. PS Key USR 36.
Specifies the number of individual I2C volume commands that will be sent to the I2S capable device every time a volume change is made.
Specifies the offset, in words, of the first I2C Volume command specified in the Raw Command Data, i.e. PS Key USR 36.
Specifies the number of bits of the volume setting in the I2C command.
Specifies the maximum volume value that will be sent to the I2S device to indicate maximum output level.
Specifies the minimum volume value that will be sent to the I2S device to indicate minimum output level.
Specifies the number of individual I2C commands that will be sent to the I2S capable device every time the device is shut down, i.e. on close of SCO or A2DP media stream.
Specifies the offset, in words, of the first I2C Shutdown command specified in the Raw Command Data, i.e. PS Key USR 36.
Specifies which I2S plugin to use.

enum.key: User Defined via PS Keys USR35 USR36

ConfigItem.Desc: Specifies Master or Slave Operation.
Choose between left justified and right justified I2S data.
The I2S data can be delayed by 1 bit.
Specifies the number of bits in each audio sample.
Specifies the music (A2DP codecs, USB, wired audio) output sample rate, e.g. 48000.
Specifies the voice (CVC) output sample rate, e.g. 48000.
Specifies the I2S bit clock when running in I2S Master mode.

ConfigGroup.EnableControl: ValueToEnable=0,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Mic A
ValueToEnable=1,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Mic A

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital microphone inputs when set.
Enables the microphone preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the “No DSP” Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Enable for Mic A
ConfigItem.Desc: This bit chooses between using the MIC bias output or a PIO to drive the MIC.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Mic A

ConfigGroup.EnableControl: ValueToEnable=0,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Mic B
ValueToEnable=1,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Mic B

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital microphone inputs when set.
Enables the microphone preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the “No DSP” Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Enable for Mic B
ConfigItem.Desc: This bit chooses between using the MIC bias output or a PIO to drive the MIC.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Mic B
ConfigItem.Desc: This bit chooses between using the MIC bias output or a PIO to drive the MIC.

ConfigGroup.EnableControl: ValueToEnable=0,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Line A
ValueToEnable=1,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Line A

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital Line inputs when set.
Enables the preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the “No DSP” Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Enable for Line A
ConfigItem.Desc: This bit chooses between using the Line bias output or a PIO to drive the Line A.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Line A
ConfigItem.Desc: This bit chooses between using the Line bias output or a PIO to drive the Line A.

ConfigGroup.EnableControl: ValueToEnable=0,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Line B
ValueToEnable=1,ConfigItemId=Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Line B

ConfigItem.Desc: Selects the digital Line inputs when set.
Enables the preamplifier when set. This bit only has an effect when the “No DSP” Audio plugin is used. CVC audio plugins automatically adjust the input gain of the device.
Sets the gain of the analogue input path.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Enable for Line B
ConfigItem.Desc: This bit chooses between using the Line bias output or a PIO to drive the Line B.

ConfigItem.Id: Drive PIO/BIAS Selection for Line B
ConfigItem.Desc: This bit chooses between using the Line bias output or a PIO to drive the Line B.
When set, I2S and DAC audio amplifier shut down in Limbo state is managed by Sink Active and Power On output PIOs, otherwise, PIO controlled power down mode is not enabled.

ConfigItem.Id: Back Channel DSP Kap File Selection
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines if the low latency DSP applications should be used when negotiating the aptX and Faststream codecs which provide additional CVC wideband back channel support.
This bitmask specifies which codecs are to be supported as SPDIF inputs. If no bits are checked SPDIF input will expect PCM. N.b. a license is required if AC3 audio is to be used.
Specifies the target latency in ms. Expected to be in the range of 0 to 150ms

ConfigGroup.Id: Audio Assignment to Left and Right Outputs

ConfigItem.Id: Channel to be Routed to Left Output
Channel to be Routed to Right Output

ConfigItem.Desc: This specifies the Cut to be applied, as a percentage.
This specifies the Boost to be applied, as a percentage.
Output mode selection, either 2.0 or multi-channel.
Enables the Low Frequency Effect algorithm.

This threshold is used to configure the silence detection used in the DSP. It is a linear level expressed as a 16 bit integer, where 32767 is full scale. If you wish to convert this into a value in dB units, the threshold to be set can be calculated as:
32767 * 10 ^ (dBthresh / 20)
Where dBthresh is the threshold level (quoted as dBFS).
10 is a reasonable default for the threshold (it equates to -70 dBFS).

The trigger time for the silence detection to fire is a 16 bit integer which gives the time in seconds.
600 is a reasonable default for the trigger time (i.e. 10 minutes).
The USB Class of Device setting will be USB_DEVICE_CLASS_TYPE_AUDIO_MICROPHONE = 0x01
The USB Class of Device setting will be USB_DEVICE_CLASS_TYPE_AUDIO_SPEAKER = 0x02
The USB Class of Device setting will be USB_DEVICE_CLASS_TYPE_BATTERY_CHARGING = 0x04
The USB Class of Device setting will be USB_DEVICE_CLASS_TYPE_MASS_STORAGE = 0x08
The USB Class of Device setting will be USB_DEVICE_CLASS_TYPE_HID_CONSUMER_TRANSPORT_CONTROL = 0x10
The USB Class of Device setting will be USB_DEVICE_CLASS_TYPE_HID_KEYBOARD = 0x20
When set the USB audio is routed even when it is not in use.
Sets the number and type of channels being used for audio routing.
Specifies the DSP plug-in to be used.
If after attaching the USB it does not enumerate within the attach timeout, in seconds, the Sink will set low power boot mode.
If the USB becomes deconfigured and no further action is taken within the deconfigured timeout period, in seconds, the Sink sets to low power boot mode.
Specifies whether to use digital, analogue, hybrid or external mode of operation for music volume control.

ConfigItem.Id: Number of Volume Steps From Min to Max
ConfigItem.Desc: Number of steps of volume change permitted in the range of 0 to (Max_Steps - 1).
Fixed DAC gain in decimal levels from 0-15 to be applied when operating in digital volume mode, ignored in other operating modes.

ConfigItem.Id: Fixed Trim Volume on Left Channel [dB/60]
ConfigItem.Desc: Trim gain left, in 1/60th dB units, configured at factory.

ConfigItem.Id: Fixed Trim Volume on Right Channel [dB/60]
ConfigItem.Desc: Trim gain right, in 1/60th dB units, configured at factory.
The first index into the list of discrete volume steps at which the gradient of the curve of dB conversion changes.

The value [dB] for the first point at which the gradient of the curve of dB conversion changes.
Warning: this value should always be configured within the range Minimum Gain [dB] < Knee Value 1 [dB] < Maximum Gain [dB].
The second index into the list of discrete volume steps at which the gradient of the curve of dB conversion changes.

The value [dB] for the second point at which the gradient of the curve of dB conversion changes.
Warning: this value should always be configured within the range Minimum Gain [dB] < Knee Value 2 [dB] < Maximum Gain [dB].

The value [dB] for the maximum volume level.
Warning: The maximum gain is constrained to 0dB in this tool. Setting gain values greater than 0dB can cause distortion of the output audio, depending on the Volume Control configuration applied in the Sink design.

The value [dB] for the minimum volume level.
Warning: The minimum gain should not be configured as greater than the Maximum Gain [dB] value.
This is the volume level used after initial power up. The default volume can be set in the range 0 to 15. The sixteen levels can be configured in PSKEY_SPEAKER_GAIN_MAPPING.
When set the mute reminder tone is played at a fixed volume, set by the default volume level parameter 'Default Volume'.
Allows the volume to be adjusted while the Sink has been muted (via the EventMuteToggle or EventMuteOn).
If the Sink is muted (via the EventMuteToggle or EventMuteOn) this bit determines the action to take when an EventVolumeUp/EventVolumeDown or an AG volume indication message occurs.
Setting this bit will result in the Sink using the low power audio codec options to help reduce Sink power consumption.
Specifies which audio plug-in is used for SCO audio connections. N.b. The bit values for the Sink SDK platform will be dependent on the DSP projects that are included in the Sink project.
When set the Sink will not send role switch requests to the AG. This feature may be useful if the AG does not support role switching.

This timer value, in minutes, causes the link encryption key to change when the timer expires, e.g. if set at 15 minutes the key used to encrypt the Bluetooth link is changed every 15 minutes, this improves the security of the Sink. Note: The encryption is only refreshed when no SCO link is open, i.e. there are no active calls. If the timer expirers when there is an active call, no action is taken and the timer is rescheduled for another timeout period.
If this item is set it enables automatic Reconnection after a power on event.
If the AutoReconnectPowerOn is enabled ActionOnPowerOn defines the AG that the Sink tries to connect to at next Power On.

enum.key: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG
Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list

ConfigItem.Id: Different SLC Connected Event at Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, the event EventSLCConnectedAfterPowerOn is generated when an SLC occurs straight after power on. The event EventSLCConnected is generated on SLC events when the Sink has already been on for some time.

ConfigItem.Id: Enter Discoverable Mode at Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: This automatically enables the connectable/discoverable mode after a power up.
When set Bluetooth 2.1 Man in the Middle enabled. Enabling this feature requires further customer development of the Sink application to support Man in the Middle mode.

ConfigItem.Id: Enter Pairing Mode on Failure to Connect
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the sink goes into pairing mode if it fails to connect with any paired devices, otherwise it goes into connectable mode.
When set this enables subwoofer RSSI pairing that ensures signal strength is higher than the configured threshold.
This allows the action taken on a pairing mode timeout to be defined.

enum.key: Power off if PDL is empty

ConfigItem.Desc: The maximum number of entries that may be stored in the paired devices list.

ConfigItem.Id: RSSI Pairing if PDL Less Than
ConfigItem.Desc: When set to a non-zero value and the number of devices in the paired devices list is less than this value, the Sink goes into RSSI Inquiry (Proximity Pairing) mode.

This bit enables secure pairing mode. If set, then the Sink only accepts pin code requests when in pairing mode (connectable/discoverable state). This prevents a remote user from pairing with the Sink without the Sink being specifically placed into pairing mode. This is over-ridden if the Sink initiates the connection. i.e. if a Sink attempts to connect to a remote AG without the correct link key (or has the bdaddr but not the link key) then the Sink will accept a pin code request.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off after PDL is Reset
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink will power off when the paired devices list is reset.

ConfigItem.Id: Pairing Mode Timeout if PDL is Empty [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: Zero to disable, if set to a non zero value this is the pairing mode timeout value, in seconds, if the PDL is completely empty. If the PDL is not empty the PairModeTimeout value is used instead.

The time in seconds that the Sink remains in the connectable / discoverable state (pairing mode). Setting this to 0 results in the Sink entering and immediately exiting discoverable mode, with the result that the device cannot be discovered. If the Sink is to always be discoverable while not connected, then the feature bit Automatic Pairing Mode Enable (see PSKEY_USR6) should be used in conjunction with this timeout.
This allows the Sink to send an answer (ATA) AT command if an incoming call is detected on connection.
This forces Encryption on SLC establishment. Some Nokia S40 phones now do not force encryption on the SLC. Setting this bit ensures that encryption is used.

Makes the Sink connectable on a button press. This is used with multipoint operation in the situation where one Sink is already connected and the user wishes to connect a second Sink and needs to make the Sink connectable to do so.
When enabled the Sink is discoverable while attempting to reconnect to a dropped device.
If this item is set the Sink remains discoverable at all times. This is useful for Multipoint operation.

This forces the Sink to Enter Discoverable mode (pairing) if the paired device list is less than the entry. An entry of 2 would mean that if the Sink has previously paired with either 0 or 1 devices, then the Sink enters discoverable mode. 0 means feature disabled.

ConfigItem.Id: Do Not Go Discoverable during Link Loss
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink does not enter discoverable mode if a link loss event has occurred.
If this item is set the Sink silently reboots and reconnects to the AG in the event of a panic.
Sets the reconnection action type if the chip reboots as a result of an application or firmware panic.

enum.key: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG
Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list

ConfigItem.Id: Reconnect Last Number of Attempts to Try
ConfigItem.Desc: When using the reconnection type of LAST, this parameter controls the number of times the Sink attempts to connect to the last connected devices, a minimum value of 2 is suggested for this parameter. The range of ReconnectLastAttempts is 0 to 7.

Defines the AG that the device will try to connect to when a call that has been transferred to an AG is transferred back to the Sink (using the Sink). The Call Transfer Reconnect Action is evoked when the Sink is used to transfer a call to the AG then back to the Sink. This only applies to AGs that disconnect the Sink when it transfers a call.

enum.key: Attempt to Reconnect to the last connected AG
Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list

ConfigItem.Desc: This specifies the number of reconnection attempts following an establish SLC event, or automatic reconnection event, if set to 0 and the reconnection action is set to 'Attempt to connect to all 8 devices in the paired device list' the PDL will be traversed once only, if this value is set to 100 for example the PDL will be traversed for 100 connection attempts.
The inquiry transmit power used. See HCI_Write_Inquiry_Transmit_Power_Level command in the Bluetooth Specification v2.1 + EDR.
The peak RSSI value that any discovered device’s RSSI value must exceed to be considered a suitable in-range device.
The difference in the RSSI values returned by two discovered devices must exceed this value in order for the Sink to initiate pairing with the stronger device.
Defines the Class of device that the inquiry looks for. Class of Device Filter values are detailed in the Assigned Number document available on the Bluetooth SIG website.
Defines the peak RSSI value that any device's RSSI value must exceed to be connected to automatically, using the RSSI auto connection feature.
Defines the difference in RSSI values returned by two devices before the stronger device is considered suitable for the auto connection feature.
Specifies a limit for the number of devices found during an inquiry search, if 0 value there is no limit on the number of devices found.
Specifies the maximum inquiry time for device searching, in units of 1.28 seconds
This is the timeout value, in seconds, for RSSI initiated pairing.
Time to wait between inquiries, in seconds.
Specifies the number of results from a search that are stored.
When set this feature will prevent the connection to any device that is not currently in the Paired Device List.
When set, this feature prevents the Sink from trying to pair to a device that has been previously paired to the Sink and is currently in the Paired Device List.
When set, this feature forces the Sink to attempt to pair/connect to the entire list of devices it found during a search.

ConfigItem.Id: Start RSSI Pairing on PDL Reset
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, the Sink will start RSSI pairing automatically if the paired device list is erased.
Will music tracks be played immediately or are they queued so that next track will be played when the current one has finished.

When set Multipoint will be configured as enabled in the HFP library. If a VM Sink application requires to use Multipoint it can then be enabled by writing to the multipoint_enable bit in the CONFIG_SESSION_DATA i.e. USR key 0. This can be achieved in one of three ways. Firstly, it can be set from this Sink config Tool using the 'Enable Multipoint in VM App' control, below. Secondly, it can be set manually from the VM App source code. Or thirdly, it can be set at runtime in the VM using an event.

When this bit is set the Sink VM application will accept two simultaneous HFP connections. This bit should be set in tandem with 'Enable Multipoint in HFP Library', above. Note: It writes to the CONFIG_SESSION_DATA (i.e. USR key 0): this is a dynamic PS Key that can also be written by the VM App - if you change this setting whilst the VM is running, on shutdown the VM App may potentially overwrite your configured value. This can be avoided by updating the device with this setting whilst the VM App is not running.
If enabled AVRCP play status is used to speed up audio source switching.
When set enables AVRCP control. This feature is not supported on some ROM variants.
When set the Sink can stream audio using an A2DP link.
This bitmask specifies which codecs are available for use. N.b. A corresponding DSP codec application must be available if these bits are enabled or the Sink will panic.

When set The Sink performs a media open when the A2DP signalling connection has been made and the A2DP stream had previously been suspended. This can happen if the Sink has suspended a stream and the phone has chosen to drop the signalling channel completely.
When set the Sink assumes that the AG is responsible for suspending the media connection when receiving an incoming call.
This feature is only present in the A2DP platform. It is used to specify the period, in seconds, over which to attempt reconnection following a link loss.
When set enables Phone Book Application Profile (PBAP) functionality.
If this item is set it enables speech recognition in the sink.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a last number redial on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.
When using multipoint operation it is possible to use two different events for triggering a voice dial operation on Audio Gateways AG1 or AG2.
When set cancels a voice dial if a last number redial is initiated.
If this configuration item is programmed with a phone number, this will be sent to the Audio Gateway when a one-touch dial call event occurs on the device.

The Sink applications include a Missed Call feature. This sends an EventMissedCall event when the Sink has seen an incoming call that did not get answered before being terminated at the remote end, this event is repeatedly sent if the MissedCallIndicateTime timer value is set to a non-zero value and repeats at the interval set by this parameter. Timer is in seconds.
This parameter specifies the number of times the missed call indication will be played at the Indicator interval time.
it is possible to tune the time, in ms, at which the speech recognition audio prompt is repeated. This may be necessary depending upon the length of audio prompt instruction chosen.
The time in seconds after which the network service indication is replayed if there is no network present in the connected AG.
nrec_function under supported_features.
Three way calling under supported_features.
cli presentation under supported_features.
cli presentation under supported_features.
volume_control under supported_features.
enhanced_call_status under supported_features.
enhanced_call_control under supported_features.
codec_negotiation under supported_features.
caller_name under CSR supported_features.
raw_text under CSR supported_features.
sms under CSR supported_features.
batt_level under CSR supported_features.
pwr_source under CSR supported_features.
codecs under CSR supported_features.
codec_bandwidths under CSR supported_features.
sco hv1 packet type.
sco hv2 packet type.
sco hv3 packet type.
esco ev3 packet type.
esco ev4 packet type.
esco ev5 packet type.
edr 2ev3 packet type.
edr 3ev3 packet type.
edr 2ev5 packet type.
edr 3ev5 packet type.
Bandwidth to use for enhanced HFP audio.
Specifies the maximum latency.
HFP 1.5 voice settings.
The Sink can be configured to support HFP and HSP profiles.
The bitmask containing the supported HFP codecs. Regardless of this setting, the application will automatically select mandatory codecs of the selected HFP profile version.
The indicator showing service status.
The indicator showing signal strength.
The indicator showing roaming status.
The indicator showing battery charge.
When set noise reduction and echo cancelling is not advertised
When set the Sink will send extended error reports.
The time, in minutes, following a link loss occurrence that the Sink will attempt to reconnect to the dropped AG.
The time interval, in seconds, at which the headset will make reconnection attempts following a link loss.

ConfigItem.Id: Play Volume Tone on Remote Indication
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink plays a tone when the volume is changed using the remote device i.e. the AG.

ConfigItem.Id: Force Second SCO to use EV3 S1 Settings
ConfigItem.Desc: Determines the behaviour of the second SCO connection in multipoint mode. When set the second SCO connection is forced to use EV3 S1 packets for better interoperability with certain AGs.

ConfigItem.Id: Mute Speaker as well as Microphone
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set Mute mutes both the Speaker and the Microphone of the Sink. This only affects HFP, not other profiles, e.g. A2DP etc.
When set the mute command is sent to both AGs when using multipoint.
Enables HFP Audio Parameters configuration settings.
This bitmask specifies the list of supported services when running in GATT client mode.
Defines GATT mode of operation (i.e. Disabled, Client or Server).
Specifies the BT User Friendly Name for the device.
The Vref input can be configured to use any of the available input sources given below.
This configures the time interval between Vref updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vref Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vref updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.
The Vbat input can be configured to use any of the available input sources given below.
This configures the time interval between Vbat updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vbat Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vbat updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.
The Vthm input can be configured to use any of the available input sources given below.
This configures the time interval between Vthm updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vthm Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vthm updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.
Delay in milliseconds between activating the thermistor PIO and taking the ADC reading. This allows the voltage level to settle before the data is sampled.
When set, the limit thresholds need to be entered as raw ADC counts. When clear they need to be in mV.
When set, a PIO is used to provide drive to the thermistor circuit.
when the Drive Thermistor PIO is set, this parameter sets the PIO required to be driven when a thermistor reading is taken.

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).

Up to seven limit thresholds may be configured to provide up to eight regions of temperature based charging control. The list is ordered in ascending voltage order. The values are in units of ADC counts or millivolts depending on the setting of vthm.raw_limits. If fewer than seven limits are specified, the terminating value is 65535 (-1).
This configures the time interval between Vchg updates in seconds while charging, 0 to disable.

ConfigItem.Id: Vchg Read Period When Not Charging [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: This configures the timer interval between Vchg updates in seconds while not charging, 0 to disable.
Sets the USB VBUS voltage threshold. The charge current can be limited at VBUS voltages below this level.
The charge current will not be decreased below this minimum level by the PMU Charger Monitor.
The charge current will not be increased above this maximum level by the PMU Charger Monitor.
This is the amount by which the charge current will be altered when it is between the minimum and maximum charge levels based on the monitored temperature.
Temperature where current will not be increased. This forms the lower temperature bound for the PMU monitor. Below this temperature the current will not be increased.
Temperature where current will be decreased. This forms the upper limit of the tolerated temperature bound after which the charge current will be decreased.

ConfigItem.Id: Temp monitor period if charger active [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Temperature monitoring period when the charger is active [ms].

ConfigItem.Id: Temp monitor period if charger idle [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Temperature monitoring period when the charger is idle [ms].

ConfigItem.Id: Temp monitor period if charger has no power [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: Temperature monitoring period when the charger has no power [ms].
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Indicates the institution that assigned the Vendor ID.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as assigned by the Vendor ID source.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product.
This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. Should be set as appropriate for the product version, where: 0xABCD = versionAB.C.D

This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. This is the most significant 32bits of the Software Version. It should be set to the appropriate software version for the product.

This information will be used in setting the Bluetooth Device ID profile fields. This is the least significant 32bits of the Software Version. It should be set to the appropriate software version for the product.
This configures a PIO to detect when SPDIF audio is being used e.g. when a connector is plugged in. This may also be configured to always assume this input is connected or disabled entirely.
This configures a PIO to detect when analog audio input is being used e.g. when a connector is plugged in. This may also be configured to always assume this input is connected or disabled entirely.
This setting has no effect.
This configures a PIO to enable the device to switch into DUT mode on power on.
This configures a PIO to be used for SPDIF input, this is required for CSR8675 and must be an odd number. This should be disabled for CSR8670 (SPDIF will still function)
Configures the PIO to drive when a call is active.
Configures the PIO to drive when an incoming call is ringing.
Configures the PIO to drive when an outgoing call is ringing.
Configures the PIO to drive when an HFP audio connection is made. i.e. The PIO will not be driven high when there is an active call, but the microphone and speakers are being used on the phone.
Configures the PIO to drive when the device powers up.

This sets a PIO to be configured for SPDIF ouput, this should be configured for CSR8675 and must be an even number. This should be set to 'N/A' for SPDIF output on CSR8670 (SPDIF output will still function)
Configures the PIO to drive when the LEDs are used.
Configures the PIO to drive audio amplifier mute line in order to minimize undesired noise during power on and power off events.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 16 to 31, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.
It is possible to invert the logic of one or many PIO inputs using a 16 bit bitmask corresponding to PIOs 0 to 15, this allows use with different hardware/button configurations.

Mapping assignments for PIO 16 to 31. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation.

Mapping assignments for PIO 0 to 15. To use certain PIOs that are shared with other hardware it is necessary to set the map pin bit for that PIO, if not set the PIO is not available for general input/output use. PIO 0 to PIO 12 are automatically mapped for general input/output access, it is not necessary to set the map pins for PIO 0 to PIO 12. Note for mapping PIO physical signals to logical input signals (for e.g. to cause User Events), see User Interface > Buttons > Translation.
Determines how pairing information is retained for ShareMe devices.
Device supports relay of audio to another ShareMe device.
Device supports receiving of audio relayed from another ShareMe device.
A connected remote ShareMe device can issue AVRCP commands to an AG connected to the local ShareMe device.
Audio routing mode for a Master TWS device relaying audio in a TWS session.
Audio routing mode for a Slave TWS device receiving audio in a TWS session.
Initial TWS Master device trim gain level, in 1/60th dB
Initial TWS Slave device trim gain level, in 1/60th dB
The increment/decrement applied to a device trim to change the current gain level, in 1/60th dB
dB value at minimum volume level, in 1/60th dB
dB value at maximum trim level, in 1/60th dB
Determines how pairing information is retained for TWS devices.
Device supports relay of audio to another TWS device.
Device supports receiving of audio relayed from another TWS device.
Determines how devices connected in a TWS session behave when issuing AVRCP commands.
Initial source selected for new TWS connections.

ConfigItem.Id: Master device pages Slave device during link loss
ConfigItem.Desc: If a link loss occurs between two Peer devices the Master device will page the Slave device. (Likely to cause audio breakup at the Master device).
Determines if the LIAC or GIAC is used when pairing Peer devices.
Peer devices will use the Device Id record to filter suitable devices.

ConfigItem.Id: Use CSR Peer Device Service UUID
ConfigItem.Desc: Use a fixed CSR defined 128-bit SDP service UUID to identify Peer device support.
Defines which IR protocol the application supports (can only support one protocol; either NEC or RC5)
The maximum number of IR codes the application can learn
Failsafe for turning off the IR learning mode [ms]

ConfigItem.Id: Timeout for Learning Mode Active Reminder Tone [ms]
ConfigItem.Desc: A reminder tone can be generated to indicate learning mode is active, this will be repeated every timeout [ms]
PIO interfacing the InfraRed hardware.

ConfigItem.Id: Maximum Number of Supported Remote Controllers
ConfigItem.Desc: Stores the maximum number of remote controllers supported
The pairing timeout (in seconds) so the BLE pairing mode is disabled after n seconds
This value allows configuration of the period with which BLE Scans are run. It is in steps of 0.625ms, with an allowed range of 0x0004 (2.5 ms) to 0x4000 (10.24 s).

This value allows configuration of the BLE Scan window. It is in steps of 0.625ms, with an allowed range of 0x0004 (2.5ms) to 0x4000 (10.24 s).
NOTE: It must be less than or equal to the 'Scan Interval for BLE' parameter value.
Address NAP for Bluetooth address of a BLE remote controller (given priority on connections)
Address UAP for Bluetooth address of a BLE remote controller (given priority on connections)
Address LAP for Bluetooth address of a BLE remote controller (given priority on connections)
Timer that is armed immediately after the first input is pressed, once this timer fires, no further multiple buttons will be included in the pattern [ms]
After a short duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when short timer fires [ms]
After a long duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when the timer fires [ms]
After a very long duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when the timer fires [ms]
After a very very long duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events when the timer fires [ms]
Every repeatTimer duration, this timer will fire, input manager can assign events on short timer firing, such as repeated volume events [ms]
The time in seconds after which the Sink switches off if not connected. If set to 0 then the Sink remains on indefinitely.
The value in seconds that the Sink waits in the limbo state for a power on event before powering off. The limbo state is entered when the device is powered or receives a power off event.

ConfigItem.Id: Disable Power Off After Power On Time [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds after Power On for which the Power Off event has no effect. This is used for example, if the UI specifies that a long press on Power On enters pairing mode but a long press at any other time (including in the connectable state) should Power Off the Sink.
Specifies the amount of time in seconds the Sink remains connectable following a successful connection when using multipoint operational modes before not being connectable any more.

This value determines the delay time, in ms, between the connection of AG1 and the start of connection to AG2 when using multipoint mode of operation. This value may be changed from its default value if interoperability issues are seen with certain AGs.
The time in seconds elapsed after the last Volume Up/Down button was pressed, to store the volume information into PS Store.

ConfigItem.Id: Wired Audio Connected Power Off Timeout [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds elapsed before the device is powered off after the wired audio is connected

ConfigItem.Id: GAIA User Defined EQ Settings Persistent Store Timeout [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The time in seconds elapsed after the last GAIA command has been received to store EQ settings into PS Store.

ConfigItem.Id: Sound Bar Audio Amplifier Power Down Timeout [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: The period in seconds for which the system waits before powering down audio amplifier for sound bar when in Limbo state.

This configuration item is used in conjunction with 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys' to force a PS Defrag to occur. The PS Defrag operation is checked at Power Off or optionally on a timer and will start automatically when the number of available PS Keys with a capacity greater than the specified 'PS Defrag Key Size' is less than 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys'.

ConfigItem.Id: PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys
ConfigItem.Desc: Forces a PS defrag when the number of available PS Keys with a capacity greater than the specified 'PS Defrag Trigger - Key Size' is less than the 'PS Defrag Trigger - Minimum Available Keys' value.
When no audio is routed the application will periodically check if a PS Defrag is required. Time in seconds, if set to zero the feature is disabled.

ConfigItem.Id: Disable Power Off after Power On
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set the Sink ignores the power off button press immediately after power on.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off only if Vreg Enable Low
ConfigItem.Desc: When set this feature prevents the Sink from powering off if the VREG enable pin is not low.

ConfigItem.Id: Reset Chip after Power Off is Complete
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink will perform a chip reset after powering off. This may be used if the BlueCore IC is powered permanently with no other form of hardware reset available.

ConfigItem.Id: Auto Power On after Initialisation Enable
ConfigItem.Desc: This feature allows a faster Sink startup period by removing the need for a power on event to be configured on a button press.

ConfigItem.Id: Power Off after Wired Audio Connected
ConfigItem.Desc: When set the Sink is powered off after the wired audio is connected

ConfigItem.Id: Play All Feedback Tones at Fixed Volume
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set Tones are played at a nominal fixed volume regardless of the current Profile Volume level.

ConfigItem.Id: Fixed Volume Level at which to play Feedback Tones
ConfigItem.Desc: This sets the volume level at which tones are played if the fixed level has been enabled. Fixed tone volume is enabled by setting PlayTonesAtFixedVolume to 1. FixedToneVolumeLevel can be set in the range 0 to 31.
This allows volume tones to be queued in the Sink.
This allows event tones to be queued in the Sink.

ConfigItem.Id: Number of Languages Supported by Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: IMPORTANT: the number of languages supported by the Audio Prompt engine if included in the build. To use Audio Prompts in the Sink device, the 'Number of Languages Supported by Audio Prompts' must be set to at least 1.
The number of audio prompts configured if the build supports audio prompts.
If set this feature will allow any audio prompt configured to indicate an incoming call to play to completion, even if the call is answered immediately or the call terminates.

ConfigItem.Id: Enable Phone Number Readout by Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When set Audio prompts are used to 'speak' an incoming caller number.

ConfigItem.Id: Read out PIN Code using Audio Prompts
ConfigItem.Desc: When set PIN/Passkey/Confirmation messages are read out using preconfigured Audio Prompts.

ConfigItem.Id: Time Before Confirming Audio Prompt Language [s]
ConfigItem.Desc: When changing audio prompt languages, it is possible to have the language change automatically confirmed and stored. If set to a non-zero value the change will be committed to ps after the configured time in seconds.
The time interval, in ms, in which a second press may be detected leading to a double press event instead of reporting the button press as a single press.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a long timer message.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very long timer message.
The time, in ms, between repeat messages being generated if a button is held down.
The time a button has to be pressed for, in ms, in order to generate a very very long timer message.
The number of debounce checks performed.
The interval between each debounce check in ms.
Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_a LED pins)
Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_b LED pins)
Define PIO_x/LED_x (to specify the PIO or LED pin connected to TriCol_c LED pins)

ConfigItem.Id: Override Filter LED is Permanently On
ConfigItem.Desc: If this item is set when displaying an override filter LED indication there will be no breaks in a solid colour display. Normal mode/event indications are suppressed for the LED chosen for the override LED filter.
Applies a scaling factor to the times used for all LED on and off times. It can be used to lengthen LED on and off times beyond that of the 2.5 second limit.
This allows LED indicator patterns to be queued in the Sink.

ConfigItem.Id: LED Disable State Reset after Boot
ConfigItem.Desc: When set, after a reboot the LED enable/disable state is reset and the LEDs are enabled independently of the led_disable parameter. When cleared the LED enable/disable state is stored over a reboot.

When set The charger LED indications stay at trickle charge once reached, i.e. the indications only change when the charger is disconnected and reconnected. When cleared The charger indications toggles between fast and trickle charge indications as appropriate to the current state of the battery charge level.

ConfigItem.Id: Ignore Button Event if Enabling LEDs
ConfigItem.Desc: When set this prevents a button from raising an event, but only when LEDs are being re-activated. It merely re-enables the display of LEDs (when they had previously timed out) but the associated event with the button press will not occur.
GAIA session enabled on connection.
GAIA connection remains after power off.
This specifies the SQIF partition to use for GAIA Over-the-Air Device Firmware Upgrade.
1 = Inverts the operation of the volume controls, 0 = Volume control normal orientation.
1 = Disables the LEDs, 0 = Enables LEDs.
The index of the Audio Prompt Language in use.
1 = Enable Low Battery intelligent Power Management, 0 = Disable Low Battery intelligent Power Management.
1 = Enable Text To Speech, 0 = Disable Text To Speech.
1 = Enable Speech Recognition, 0 = Disable Speech Recognition.
Note: 0x7 selects the option to use the last customer defined Equaliser settings.
Frequency stored on last FM Rx use.

ConfigItem.Id: RSQ Low Threshold for RSSI Interrupt
RSQ High Threshold for RSSI Interrupt
RSQ Low Threshold for SNR Interrupt
RSQ High Threshold for SNR Interrupt

ConfigPatternArray.Name: User Defined Tones
ConfigPatternArray.Desc: This is the raw data for the User Defined Tones.

ConfigPatternArray.Name: AT Command Buffer
ConfigPatternArray.Desc: This is the raw data for the AT commands
